BNC User Reference Guide

<person>

person provides information about an identifiable individual, for example a participant in a language interaction, or a person referred to in a historical source.
Class att.uniqueId
Declaration 
element person
{
   attribute ageGroup { text }?,
   attribute dialect { text }?,
   attribute firstLang
   {
      "XX-XXX" | "DE-DEU" | "FR-FRA" | "EN-GBR" | "EN-USA" | "XX-IND"
   }?,
   attribute n { text }?,
   attribute educ { "Ed0" | "Ed1" | "Ed4" | "X" }?,
   attribute soc { "AB" | "C1" | "C2" | "DE" | "UU" }?,
   attribute sex { "m" | "f" | "u" }?,
   attribute role { text }?,
   att.uniqueId.attribute.xmlid,
   ( model.pLike+ | ( model.personPart | model.global )* )
}
Attributes
(In addition to global attributes and those inherited from [att.uniqueId ] )
ageGroup specifies the age group to which the participant belongs.
Status: Optional
Values are:
Ag0 Under 15 years.
Ag1 15 to 24 years.
Ag2 25 to 34 years.
Ag3 35 to 44 years.
Ag4 45 to 59 years.
Ag5 Over 59 years.
X Unknown.
dialect specifies the dialect or accent of a participant's speech, as identified by the respondent.
Status: Optional
Values are:
CAN Canadian.
NONE No accent recorded.
XDE German.
XEA East Anglian.
XFR French.
XHC Home Counties .
XHM Humberside.
XIR Irish.
XIS Indian subcontinent.
XLC Lancashire.
XLO London.
XMC Central Midlands.
XMD Merseyside.
XME North-east Midlands.
XMI Midlands.
XMS South Midlands.
XMW North-west Midlands.
XNC Central Northern England.
XNE North-east England.
XNO Northern England.
XOT Other or unidentifiable.
XSD Scottish.
XSL Lower south-west England.
XSS Central south-west England.
XSU Upper south-west England.
XUR European.
XUS American (US).
XWA Welsh.
XWE West Indian.
firstLang specifies the country of origin of the participant, as identified by the respondent.
Status: Optional
Datatype (1–1) data.enumerated
Legal values are:
XX-XXX Unknown.
DE-DEU German.
FR-FRA French.
EN-GBR British English.
EN-USA North American English.
XX-IND Unknown Indian language.
n internal identifier.
Status: Optional
Datatype (1–1) text
educ specifies the age at which the participant ceased full-time education.
Status: Optional
Datatype (1–1) data.enumerated
Legal values are:
Ed0 Still in education.
Ed1 Left school aged 14 or under.
Ed4 Education continued until age 19 or over.
X Unknown.
soc specifies the social class of the participant.
Status: Optional
Datatype (1–1) data.enumerated
Legal values are:
AB Higher management: administrative or professional.
C1 Lower management: supervisory or clerical.
C2 Skilled manual.
DE Semi-skilled or unskilled.
UU Social class unknown.
sex specifies the sex of the participant.
Status: Optional
Datatype (1–1) data.enumerated
Legal values are:
m male.
f female.
u unknown.
role describes the relationship or role of this participant with respect to the respondent.
Status: Optional
Values: 77 discrete values are used
Example
 <person
   ageGroup="4"
   xml:id="PS1V0"
   role="unspecified"
   sex="f"
   soc="UU"
   dialect="NONE"
   educ="X"
xmlns:xaira="http://www.xaira.org/ns/1.0/spec"
xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
xmlns:rng="http://relaxng.org/ns/structure/1.0">
  <age>55</age>
  <persName>Nola</persName>
  <occupation>british rail employee</occupation>
 </person>
Note

May contain either a prose description organized as paragraphs, or a sequence of more specific demographic elements drawn from the model.personPart class.
Module namesdates
